document_data.name: Vammas
document_data.mainbody: '''Vammas''' was one of the  numerous noble families that composed the [[patriar]] of [[Baldur's Gate]].
document_data.Activities: Vammas made its fortune from controlling the majority of trade with [[Chult]].
document_data.Base of Operations: The family's city estate, known as [[Vammas House]], stood in the [[Temples District]] of the Gate's [[Upper City]], between two crossings: [[Belltoll Street]] and [[Wendserpent Street]] in the north and [[Sornbanner Street]] and Wendserpent Street to the south.{{cite web| url = https://web.archive.org/web/20220221195407/http://www.candlekeep.com/library/articles/sse/sse_1112-04.htm| title = So Saith Ed Nov â€“ Dec 2004| accessdate = 25-11-2021| date = 25-11-2021}}
document_data.Members:
[[File:Vammas sisters.png|thumb|''Two eldest daughters of the Vammas family.''|330x330px]]
A late 15{{th}} century [[DR]] painting by [[Oskar Fevras]] depicted two contemporary eldest sisters, scions of the Vammas family, conspiring to shake up their noble bloodline. Both sisters appeared be [[human]]s with light skin tone and dark hair.

Lord [[Randolf Vammas]], a member of the [[Parliament of Peers]], was one of the guests who attended [[Enver Gortash]]'s coronation in [[Wyrm's Rock]] of Baldur's Gate in the {{YearlinkName|1492}}.
